definition: to evolve (of ideas, designs, constructions etc)/to develop and change
to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]

sentences.english: Life is always developing into different forms.
sentences.chinese: 生命总是在不断地衍化成不同的形态。

sentences.english: Chapter II focuses on the generation and derivation of the customs on July 7.
sentences.chinese: 第二章写七月七日风俗的产生与衍化。

sentences.english: Empress the derivation sends for three king's surname clans.
sentences.chinese: 后衍化为三支王姓族派。

sentences.english: Yama's image developed in Tang and the following Five Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐五代时期是阎罗王形象的最重要的衍化期。

sentences.english: Objective To compare and optimize the derivation technique of Serogroup C meningococcal polysaccharide.
sentences.chinese: 目的筛选和优化C群脑膜炎多糖的衍化工艺。

sentences.english: The legend derives from the myth about Cowherd and Weaver Girl before Dang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 该传说是在唐以前牵牛织女神话的基型上衍化而成。

definition: to develop/to evolve
to evolve/evolution
to deduce/to infer/an implication/same as 推演
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
concise/compact/condensed
heaven and earth/yin and yang
the absolute beginning
abstruse/profound mystery/the mysteries of the universe
yin and yang
primal chaos/formless mass before creation in Chinese mythology/muddled/innocent as a baby
to split heaven and earth apart (idiom); refers to the Pangu 盤古|盘古[Pan2 gu3] creation myth
to be transformed/to metamorphose/transformation/metamorphosis
the distant past/ancient times/antiquity/early historical times
origin/source
